total_revenue.context: Net sales increased 10% to $187.8 billion in the fourth quarter, compared with $170.0 billion in fourth quarter 2023. Excluding the $0.9 billion unfavorable impact from year-over-year changes in foreign exchange rates throughout the quarter, net sales increased 11% compared with fourth quarter 2023.
total_revenue.fx_impact: Foreign exchange rates had an unfavorable impact of $0.9 billion on net sales growth.

net_sales.context: North America segment sales increased 10% year-over-year to $115.6 billion.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for North America were $106.33 billion in Q4 2024.

operating_income.context: North America segment operating income was $9.3 billion, compared with operating income of $6.5 billion in fourth quarter 2023.

net_sales.context: International segment sales increased 8% year-over-year to $43.4 billion, or increased 9% excluding changes in foreign exchange rates.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for International were $42.105 billion in Q4 2024.

operating_income.context: International segment operating income was $1.3 billion, compared with an operating loss of $0.4 billion in fourth quarter 2023.

net_sales.context: AWS segment sales increased 19% year-over-year to $28.8 billion.

operating_expenses.context: Operating expenses for AWS were $18.154 billion in Q4 2024.

operating_income.context: AWS segment operating income was $10.6 billion, compared with operating income of $7.2 billion in fourth quarter 2023.

net_sales.context: Consolidated net sales increased 10% to $187.8 billion in Q4 2024.

operating_expenses.context: Consolidated operating expenses were $166.589 billion in Q4 2024, compared to $156.752 billion in Q4 2023.

operating_income.context: Operating income increased to $21.2 billion in the fourth quarter, compared with $13.2 billion in fourth quarter 2023.

total_expenses.context: Total operating expenses increased from $156.752 billion in Q4 2023 to $166.589 billion in Q4 2024.
key_factors: Investment in technology and content, particularly AI
Increased fulfillment costs due to higher volume

Technology_and_content.context: Technology and content expenses were $23.571 billion.

Marketing.context: Sales and marketing expenses were $13.124 billion.

General_and_administrative.context: General and administrative expenses were $2.863 billion.

Other.context: Other operating expense (income), net was $176 million.

Stock_based_Compensation.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $4.995 billion in Q4 2024.

operating_income.context: Operating income increased to $21.2 billion in Q4 2024.

net_income.context: Net income increased to $20.0 billion in the fourth quarter.

eps.context: Diluted earnings per share was $1.86, compared with $1.00 in fourth quarter 2023.

free_cash_flow.context: Free cash flow increased to $38.2 billion for the trailing twelve months.

operating_cash_flow.context: Operating cash flow increased 36% to $115.9 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_principal_repayments.context: Free cash flow less principal repayments of finance leases and financing obligations increased to $35.5 billion for the trailing twelve months.

free_cash_flow_less_equipment_and_other_.context: Free cash flow less equipment finance leases and principal repayments of all other finance leases and financing obligations increased to $36.2 billion for the trailing twelve months.

capital_expenditures.context: Capital investments were $26.3 billion in the fourth quarter.

share_repurchase.context: Share repurchase details not provided in the Q4 2024 highlights.

total_employees.context: Employees (full-time and part-time; excludes contractors & temporary personnel) increased to 1,556,000 in Q4 2024, up 2% year-over-year.

market_position.description: Amazon delivered its fastest speeds ever for Prime members in 2024 and maintained its position as a price leader.
initiatives: Launched Amazon Haul, a new shopping experience with ultra-low prices.
Expanded same-day delivery sites by more than 60% in 2024.
Delivered over 9 billion units the same or next day globally.
Named lowest-priced U.S. retailer by Profitero for the eighth year in a row.
goals: Continue to lower cost to serve.
Lead in generative AI infrastructure and applications.
examples: Delivered over 65% more items to U.S. Prime members the same day or overnight than in Q4 2023.
Record-breaking Black Friday Week and Cyber Monday.

innovation.description: Significant innovation in AWS AI capabilities and fulfillment network robotics.
initiatives: Launched Trainium2 AI chips and Trainium2 UltraServers.
Project Rainier: Building world's largest AI compute cluster with Anthropic.
Added DeepSeek, Luma AI, and poolside models to Bedrock.
Launched Amazon Q Transformations for mainframe migrations.
goals: Provide best price-performance for AI compute.
Enable easy building of generative AI applications.
examples: Trainium2 offers 30-40% better price-performance than current GPU instances.
Amazon Q helped Amazon save $260 million in Java upgrades.

acquisitions.description: Focus on organic growth and innovation.

ecosystem_development.description: Expanding Prime benefits and media offerings.
initiatives: Prime Video ads completed first year.
Launched new fuel discount for Prime members.
examples: Red One was Amazon MGM Studiosâ€™ most-watched film debut ever.
Fuel discount of $0.10 per gallon at BP Amoco and Ampm stations.

social_initiatives.description: Commitment to sustainability and community support.
initiatives: World's largest corporate purchaser of renewable energy for fifth straight year.
Disaster relief support for California wildfires and flooding in Spain.
examples: More than 600 wind and solar projects globally.
$10 million in donations for California wildfire relief.

revenue_growth.expectation: Net sales are expected to be between $151.0 billion and $155.5 billion, or to grow between 5% and 9% compared with first quarter 2024.
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Includes approximately 150 basis points unfavorable impact from foreign exchange rates.
factors: Comparison against leap year in Q1 2024 (120 basis points impact).

core_trends: Continued investment in AI and AWS infrastructure.
Focus on lowering cost to serve in stores business.

capital_expenditures_guidance.reason_for_adjustment: Q4 run rate ($26.3B) reasonably representative of 2025 rate.

revenue.context: Net sales expected to be between $151.0 billion and $155.5 billion.

operating_income.context: Operating income is expected to be between $14.0 billion and $18.0 billion.

operating_environment_challenges: Capacity constraints in AI supply chain (chips, power).

stock_based_compensation_expense.context: Total stock-based compensation expense was $4.995 billion in Q4 2024.

ww_shipping_costs.context: Worldwide shipping costs were $28.549 billion in Q4 2024.

common_shares_outstanding.context: 10.593 billion shares outstanding as of December 31, 2024.
